subject: Investing
title: Comparable Sales Analysis
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Comparable Sales Analysis.

hook.text: A seller listed a house at $350,000. A quick comp check showed similar homes selling for $290,000.

buildup.text: Comparable salesâ€”or 'comps'â€”are recent sales of similar properties in the same area.

discovery.text: Good comps match on location, size, age, and condition, and closed within the past six months.

twist.text: Appraisers use comps too. If your offer exceeds comp values, the bank may refuse to lend.

climax.text: Mastering comps lets you spot overpriced listings and negotiate from a position of data.

punchline.text: Comps don't lie. They tell you what buyers actually paid.

quiz.question: What are comparable sales based on?
options: Recent sales of similar nearby properties
